subject: Leadership
title: Nonverbal Communication in Teams
description: Learn Nonverbal Communication in Teams in one minute.

hook.text: A leader says 'I'm open to ideas' while crossing arms and checking her phone. The team hears only body language.

buildup.text: Mehrabian's research suggests up to 93% of emotional meaning comes from tone and body language, not words.

discovery.text: Leaders' nonverbal cues set the emotional tone for the entire team. A tense leader creates a tense room.

twist.text: In remote teams, nonverbal cues shrink to a small video frame. Tone in messages becomes the primary signal.

climax.text: Awareness is the first step: record yourself in meetings, notice posture, and align body language with words.

punchline.text: Your body speaks before your mouth does.

quiz.question: Why is nonverbal communication crucial for leaders?
options: It replaces the need for verbal communication
It sets the emotional tone for the team
It only matters in in-person settings
